description: Machine-assisted moderation of text and images.Image moderation - enhance your ability to detect potentially offensive or unwanted images through machine-learning based classifiers, custom blacklists, and optical character recognition (OCR).Text moderation - helps you detect potential profanity in more than 100 languages and match text against your custom lists automatically. Content Moderator also checks for possible personally identifiable information (PII).
steps: Subscribe to the Content Moderator API on the Microsoft Azure portal.(https://portal.azure.com/#create/Microsoft.CognitiveServices/apitype/ContentModerator)
Sign up for the content moderator review tool.(http://contentmoderator.cognitive.microsoft.com/)
In settings->credential section you will see apiKey (Ocp-Apim-Subscription-Key)

blocks.name: evaluateImage
blocks.description: Returns probabilities of the image containing racy or adult content.

args.name: availableApi
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.

args.name: cacheImage
args.info: Whether to retain the submitted image for future use; defaults to false if omitted.

blocks.name: findFaces
blocks.description: Returns probabilities of the image containing faces.

args.name: availableApi
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.

args.name: cacheImage
args.info: Whether to retain the submitted image for future use; defaults to false if omitted.

blocks.name: getMatchImage
blocks.description: Fuzzily match an image against one of your custom Image Lists. You can create and manage your custom image lists using this API.Returns ID and tags of matching image.

args.name: availableApi
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.

args.name: cacheImage
args.info: Whether to retain the submitted image for future use; defaults to false if omitted.

blocks.name: getImageText
blocks.description: Returns any text found in the image for the language specified.

args.name: availableApi
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.

args.name: cacheImage
args.info: Whether to retain the submitted image for future use; defaults to false if omitted.

args.name: enhanced
args.info: When set to True, the image goes through additional processing to come with additional candidates.Image/tiff is not supported when enhanced is set to true.Note: This impacts the response time.

blocks.name: detectLanguage
blocks.description: This operation will detect the language of given input content. Returns the ISO 639-3 code for the predominant language comprising the submitted text. Over 110 languages supported.

args.name: contentType
args.info: Media type of the body sent to the API.

args.name: availableApi
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.

blocks.name: detectProfanityLanguage
blocks.description: The operation detects profanity in more than 100 languages and match against custom and shared blacklists.

args.name: contentType
args.info: Media type of the body sent to the API.

args.name: availableApi
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.

args.name: language
args.info: Optional parameter. If no language is specified, it would default to English.

args.name: autocorrect
args.info: Runs auto correction on the input, before running other operations.

args.name: personalIdentifiableInformation
args.info: Detects Personal Identifiable Information (PII) in the input.

args.name: listId
args.info: The list to be for matching.

blocks.name: addImageInList
blocks.description: Add an Image to your image list. The image list can be used to do fuzzy matching against other images when using Image/Match API.

args.name: availableApi
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.

args.name: listId
args.info: The list to be for matching.

args.name: tag
args.info: The list to be for matching.

args.name: label
args.info: Any additional information about the reference image.

blocks.name: deleteImageFromList
blocks.description: Delete an Image from your image list. The image list can be used to do fuzzy matching against other images when using Image/Match API.

args.name: availableApi
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.

args.name: listId
args.info: The list to be for matching.

blocks.name: deleteAllImagesFromList
blocks.description: Delete all images from your list. The image list can be used to do fuzzy matching against other images when using Image/Match API.

args.name: availableApi
args.info: The region that most closely describes your location.

args.name: listId
args.info: The list to be for matching.
